result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin R. Revis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Calvin R. Revis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Calvin R. Revis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Sexual offender evaluation and follow through
Counseling as deemed appropriate
No contact with P.R., siblings, or parents

Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin R. Revis in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF154 and 14CF155 @ 10:58 a.m. Written plea agreement filed. State has complied with VNR. 14CF155 Will amend ct 1 DC 947.01(1), cts 2 & 3 dismiss. Withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, sex offender evaluation, counseling deemed appropriate, court costs, no contact with named victim, siblings or parents.  14CF154 - amend to DC, withheld, 1 yr probation with same conditions. 
14CF154 - Ct 1 amended to disorderly conduct. Court reviews charge and possible penalties. Def understands. No contest plea.
14CF155 - Ct 1 amended to disorderly conduct. Court reviews charge and possible penalties. Def understands. No contest plea.
Court reviews constitutional rights. Court satisfied and finds factual basis. Approves plea agreement. Cts 2 & 3 dismissed in 14CF155. Court finds guilty of amended cts. Def has nothing to say. On each case, sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, concurrent, sex offender evaluation and follow through, any counseling deemed appropriate. No contact with KR, siblings or parents.  Costs in each case including DNA surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Off the record briefly. Back on the record. 14CFR155 No contact with PR, siblings, or parents. Court reviews letter from poster. Bond apply to costs, return balance to person named in letter. Postconviction rights.

Attorney Shawn M Paul in court via telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recalled 1:00 p.m.  Court did an in camera review of material. Did not find material to be relevant to Defense and will not order disclosure. Motion denied. Atty Paul asks material be kept sealed in file for possible appeal purposes. No objection by the State. Court so orders.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Shawn M Paul in court via telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 14CF154 and 14CF155 @ 8:36 a.m. Discusssion regarding in camera review. Court will review and case will be recalled at 1:00 p.m.
For In Camera Inspection of Department of Social Services Records Regarding Alleged Victims - See 14CF154

Attorney Shawn M Paul in court by telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF154 and 14CF155 @ 1:30 p.m. Motion for in camera review. State has no objection and has documents available for the Court's review, Atty Paul will draft order. Atty Paul agrees, addresses second part of motion. Response by State.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
For in Camera Inspection of Department of Social Services Records Regarding Alleged Victims - see 14CF154

Defendant Calvin R. Revis in court with attorney Shawn M Paul by phone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 14CF154 & 14CF155.  Def to waive preliminary hearing.  Written waiver filed.  Court explains right to preliminary hearing Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause.  Informations filed for both cases.  Waive reading of informations.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept not guilty pleas.  Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Calvin R. Revis in court with attorney Shawn M Paul by phone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF154 & 14CF155.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Calvin R. Revis in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 14CF154 & 14CF155.  Def does not have copy of complaints.  Court vacates warrant.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Copies of complaints will be provided to def.  State request $5000.00 cash bond.  Conditions requested   Bond set by court.  Bond will cover both files  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
